result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kyle T Welhouse was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript of December 21, 2018 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation

(SF) Case called at 11:09 am
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court has reviewed the file and the sentencing transcript for this case.
DA Happ advises that she does not have any factual correction to the revocation information.
Attorney Dahnert presents sentencing argument.
Defendant makes statement to the Court.

Attorney Dahnert presents custody credit worksheet to the Court.

The Court sentences Mr. Welhouse to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 519 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay outstanding court ordered financial obligations

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:39 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 21, 2018 at 11:00 am.

[Scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation Hearing]

[ma] Case called at 10:53 AM 
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse in court, in custody with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies review of sentencing transcript and revocation packet

Attorney Dahnert indicates that she was unaware of the appointment and requests an adjournment. 

recess:10:59am

Cases 15CF204 & 15TR5392 called together at 3:37 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for MH/FSSC)
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments presented by Atty Dahnert in support for motion; Statements by Mr. Welhouse
Court has colloquy with parties - Court informs parties that It will leave trial on calendar and will take plea today, tomorrow or Thursday
off-record: 3:58  - 4:20 pm 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 and 15TR5392
Statements by Donna Roscioli

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 12 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 12/31/15 at 6:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay a fine of $4500 + costs
--To pay $56.74 blood testing fee (JESO)
--SCRAM to continue until commencement of jail term

Conditions NOT of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served: days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Defendant to report to probation no later than 12/2/15 during normal business hours
Recess:  4:39 pm

[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]

Request for Detainer w/fax confirmation

Case called at 9:51am [mo]
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Defense's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Atty. Dahnert updates the Court as to SCRAM in the Waukesha Co. Huber Facility
--The Court modifies Mr. Welhouse's bond condition regarding SCRAM to read: 

--The Defendant is required to make arrangements to be equipped with a SCRAM alcohol monitoring braclet as soon as possible following his transfer to the Waukesha County Huber facility. Thereafter, Mr. Welhouse is comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. 

Atty. Dahnert requests that Case 15TR5392 track with this case
--No objection from the State
The Court orders that Case 15TR5392 is to track with this case and any default judgement shall be vacated and case is to be re-opened. 

recess: 10:03am

NEXT: (1) PreTrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 11:20am (2) Preliminary Hearing on 9/11/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 2:11pm [mo]
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Dahnert request an additional PTC, indicates that Mr. Welhouse is in custody on a child support case in Waukesha Co. 

Atty. Dahnert request a bond modification in that Mr. Welhouse not be required to have SCRAM monitoring so long as he is incarcerated
--ADA Beck gives arguments against bond modification.
The Court indicates that it would like to speak to WCS/SCRAM installation personnel
recess: 2:15pm--reconvene: 2:27pm [to allow Atty. Dahnert to attempt to locate WCS personnel]

Atty. Dahnert informs the Court that the WCS personal are not at the Jefferson County Courthouse on Fridays
Mr. Welhouse is to be writted back to Jefferson Co. on 8/11/15 for a continued status conference and for bond modification decision
The State is to prepare the Writ
recess:2:31pm

NEXT: Status Conference on 8/11/15 at 9:45am
NOH for Def. for 8/7/15 Status Conference//Def. in Custody at Waukesha Co. Jail

Case called at 1:27 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kyle T Welhouse appears via video, in-custody, from the Jefferson Count Jail, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (for SPD). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Atty Dahnert indicates that Mr. Wellhouse qualifies for SPD services
Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses 
-Not drive without a valid driver license
-he Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
 The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
Recess: 1:31 pm

NEXT: (1) STC scheduled for at 8/7/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
